summary: By buying directly from the commercial marketplace, DOD can take advantage of the latest innovations and reduce its purchasing costs. We found that, as a portion of DOD's total contract spending, contracts awarded using federal procedures to purchase commercial items (for both products and services) have declined slightly between fiscal years 2007 and 2016, roughly in line with the decline in DOD's total spending. title: Defense Contracts: Recent Legislation and DOD Actions Related to Commercial Item Acquisitions
